title: Homeric Hymns To Dionysus 4
body: the Nymphs raised the infant Dionysius in Nysa endukéōs. endukéōs is generally associated with the notion of an uninterrupted sequence. See Od. XIV.337, Od. XIV.334, Od. XIV.338, Od. XIV.111, Od. IX.489, Od. X.245, Od. VI.273, Od. XV.305, Od. XVII.111, Od. XVII.113, Od. XIV.390, Od. X.65, Od. XV.491

title: Homeric Hymns To Dionysus 11
body: in a list of examples where the hymnic salutation khaire/khairete is not followed by an explicit metabasis

title: Homeric Hymns To Dionysus 12-13
body: analysis of use of hōrā to indicate that the context of the performance of the Hymns is a seasonally recurring festival
